result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon Devon Hamza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with the State Agency Housing Department.
Mental Health Assessment and with follow up care and treatment with the Mental Health Unit.
Take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment and treatment.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court waived mandatory court costs. Defendant unable to work due to mental disabilities and financial situation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon Devon Hamza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, with credit for 0 days time served.  

Court  IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions and to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Court waived mandatory court costs.  Defendant unable to work due to mental disabilities and financial situation.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Cooperate with the State Agency Housing Department.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Community service of 25 hours.
*  Mental Health assessment and with follow up care and treatment with the Mental Health Unit.
*  Take all prescribed medications.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Shannon Devon Hamza in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Shannon Devon Hamza in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Court ordered the stayed bench warrant canceled.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Shannon Devon Hamza not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next date.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Court retained file.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Pick N Save - 5700 W Capitol Drive
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Shannon Devon Hamza in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  
Defendant Shannon Devon Hamza in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  
Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
